key_points: Hunter Mannies claimed to have encountered a man he believes was Brian Laundrie in Bullwinkle’s Saloon, West Yellowstone, on Aug. 26.
Mannies described Laundrie as appearing “mad at the world” and alone at the bar.
The encounter occurred one day before Gabby Petito was last reported seen alive.
During a conversation involving hunting, guns, and politics, Laundrie allegedly insulted Southerners and Republicans.
Mannies and his friend engaged Laundrie in conversation, during which Laundrie identified himself by name.
Mannies and a friend felt that Laundrie was oddly invested in their conversation and described his demeanor as giving them a “weird vibe”.
After Petito's disappearance was reported, Mannies' friend recognized Laundrie as the man from the bar.
Mannies viewed body camera footage of Laundrie and Petito and felt certain that the man he saw was Laundrie.
Mannies, a former deputy, reported his sighting to the FBI and spoke with them for about 45 minutes.
Gabby Petito’s remains were discovered in Wyoming’s Bridger-Teton National Forest; her death was ruled a homicide.
